title.narrative: Introducing 3R in impact areas of DWA

description.narrative: Awareness raising on 3R and fact finding to suit ToT modules to the local context are being carried out. The development of 3R ToT modules is under process.

Awareness raising: 3R approach is not well known in Kenya. Accordingly, seminars, discussions and trainings will be carried out. Governmental, Non Governmental and Civil societies will be engaged. Training material: Technical guidelines, Audio-visual material, ToT training modules will be developed to fit the local socio-economic, institutional and physical characteristics. ToT training: interested local parties from the alliance and others will be empowered to train third party organizations on 3R approach and practices. The training will involve KWA partners and other interested parties.

Financial sustainability : This prohject envisages to achieve sustainability according to the FIETS framework: (F)inancial Sustainability: the project aims to introduce 3R to KWA partners and others aiming to create a sustainable financial loop in which co-financing is central. Additionally the interest of WRMA to 3R could bring additional fundings to sustain the efforts of the alliance. (I)stitutional sustainability: The government thorugh Water Resource Management authority is interested in 3R. By adding value to the WRMA activities, 3R can hopefully become integrating part of the government effort in creating sustainable access to WASH services. (E)nvironmental sustainability: 3R aims to create a healthy water buffer to face water scarcity in drought prone areas. By creating extra storage within the landscape 3R will decrease the pressure on traditionally tapped water resources such as groundwater. (T)echnical Sustainability: Technically 3R involves a vaste package of techniques. The techniques can be picked - to fit local conditions and needs - by local organizations in order to achieve maximum technical sustainability. (S)ocial sustainabilty: Participatory involvement of communities in each phase of the 3R approach is of paramount importance. Local KWA partners are the key to introduce 3R without disrupting the social patterns that characterize Kajiado district. Particular attention is given to understand and address the pastoralists communities needs and challenges.

Kenya is one the eight countries where the Dutch WASH Alliance Program is working. The program focuses on water, sanitation and hygiene components in Kajiado district. In this region, it mainly focuses on pastoralist and communities where access to WASH service is relatively difficult threatening the livelihood of women, children and the broader society.

The introduction of 3R approach and techniques need to fit the local conditions and needs. For this reasons Awareness raising, investigations and parnterships are of foremost importance in order to achieve sustainability and long term impact in the KWA target areas. Capacity buiding through trainings and production of training materal are the main goals.

The projects aims to introduce the 3R approach in the Dutch Wash Alliance program for Kenya.
